verses.text: \w Zedekiah|strong="H6667"\w* \add was\add* \w one|strong="H0259"\w* and \w twenty|strong="H6242"\w* \w years|strong="H8141"\w* \w old|strong="H1121"\w* when he began to \w reign|strong="H4427"\w*, and he \w reigned|strong="H4427"\w* \w eleven|strong="H0259"\w* \w years|strong="H8141"\w* in \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*. And his \w mother’s|strong="H0517"\w* \w name|strong="H8034"\w* \add was\add* \w Hamutal|strong="H2537"\w* the \w daughter|strong="H1323"\w* of \w Jeremiah|strong="H3414"\w* of \w Libnah|strong="H3841"\w*.\f + \fr 52.1 \ft began…: Heb. reigned\f*

And he \w did|strong="H6213"\w* \add that which was\add* \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* in the \w eyes|strong="H5869"\w* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, according to all that \w Jehoiakim|strong="H3079"\w* had \w done|strong="H6213"\w*.

For \w through|strong="H5921"\w* the \w anger|strong="H0639"\w* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* it came to pass in \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w* and \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w*, till he had cast them \w out|strong="H7993"\w* from his \w presence|strong="H6440"\w*, that \w Zedekiah|strong="H6667"\w* \w rebelled|strong="H4775"\w* against the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w*.

¶ And it came to pass in the \w ninth|strong="H8671"\w* \w year|strong="H8141"\w* of his \w reign|strong="H4427"\w*, in the \w tenth|strong="H6224"\w* \w month|strong="H2320"\w*, in the \w tenth|strong="H6218"\w* \add day\add* of the \w month|strong="H2320"\w*, \add that\add* \w Nebuchadrezzar|strong="H5019"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w* \w came|strong="H0935"\w*, he and all his \w army|strong="H2428"\w*, against \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*, and \w pitched|strong="H2583"\w* against it, and \w built|strong="H1129"\w* \w forts|strong="H1785"\w* against it round \w about|strong="H5439"\w*.

\w So|strong="H0935"\w* the \w city|strong="H5892"\w* was \w besieged|strong="H4692"\w* unto the \w eleventh|strong="H6249"\w* \w year|strong="H8141"\w* of \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w Zedekiah|strong="H6667"\w*.

And in the \w fourth|strong="H7243"\w* \w month|strong="H2320"\w*, in the \w ninth|strong="H8672"\w* \add day\add* of the \w month|strong="H2320"\w*, the \w famine|strong="H7458"\w* was \w sore|strong="H2388"\w* in the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*, so that there was no \w bread|strong="H3899"\w* for the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* of the \w land|strong="H0776"\w*.

Then the \w city|strong="H5892"\w* was broken \w up|strong="H1234"\w*, and all the \w men|strong="H0582"\w* of \w war|strong="H4421"\w* \w fled|strong="H1272"\w*, and went \w forth|strong="H3318"\w* out of the \w city|strong="H5892"\w* by \w night|strong="H3915"\w* by the \w way|strong="H1870"\w* of the \w gate|strong="H8179"\w* between the two \w walls|strong="H2346"\w*, which \add was\add* by the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w garden|strong="H1588"\w*; (now the \w Chaldeans|strong="H3778"\w* \add were\add* by the \w city|strong="H5892"\w* round \w about|strong="H5439"\w*:) and they \w went|strong="H3212"\w* by the \w way|strong="H1870"\w* of the \w plain|strong="H6160"\w*.

¶ But the \w army|strong="H2428"\w* of the \w Chaldeans|strong="H3778"\w* \w pursued|strong="H7291"\w* \w after|strong="H0310"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, and \w overtook|strong="H5381"\w* \w Zedekiah|strong="H6667"\w* in the \w plains|strong="H6160"\w* of \w Jericho|strong="H3405"\w*; and all his \w army|strong="H2428"\w* was \w scattered|strong="H6327"\w* from him.

Then they \w took|strong="H8610"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, and carried him \w up|strong="H5927"\w* unto the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w* to \w Riblah|strong="H7247"\w* in the \w land|strong="H0776"\w* of \w Hamath|strong="H2574"\w*; where he \w gave|strong="H1696"\w* \w judgment|strong="H4941"\w* upon him.

And the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w* \w slew|strong="H7819"\w* the \w sons|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Zedekiah|strong="H6667"\w* before his \w eyes|strong="H5869"\w*: he \w slew|strong="H7819"\w* also all the \w princes|strong="H8269"\w* of \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w* in \w Riblah|strong="H7247"\w*.

Then he put \w out|strong="H5786"\w* the \w eyes|strong="H5869"\w* of \w Zedekiah|strong="H6667"\w*; and the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w* \w bound|strong="H0631"\w* him in \w chains|strong="H5178"\w*, and \w carried|strong="H0935"\w* him to \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w*, and \w put|strong="H5414"\w* him in \w prison|strong="H1004"\w* till the \w day|strong="H3117"\w* of his \w death|strong="H4194"\w*.\f + \fr 52.11 \ft put out: Heb. blinded\f*\f + \fr 52.11 \ft chains: or, fetters\f*\f + \fr 52.11 \ft prison: Heb. house of the wards\f*

¶ Now in the \w fifth|strong="H2549"\w* \w month|strong="H2320"\w*, in the \w tenth|strong="H6218"\w* \add day\add* of the \w month|strong="H2320"\w*, which \add was\add* the \w nineteenth|strong="H8672"\w* \w year|strong="H8141"\w* of \w Nebuchadrezzar|strong="H5019"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w*, \w came|strong="H0935"\w* \w Nebuzar-adan|strong="H5018"\w*, \w captain|strong="H7227"\w* of the \w guard|strong="H2876"\w*, \add which\add* \w served|strong="H5975"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w*, into \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*,\f + \fr 52.12 \ft captain…: or, chief marshal: Heb. chief of the executioners, or, slaughtermen\f*\f + \fr 52.12 \ft served: Heb. stood before\f*

And \w burned|strong="H8313"\w* the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w*; and all the \w houses|strong="H1004"\w* of \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*, and all the \w houses|strong="H1004"\w* of the \w great|strong="H1419"\w* \add men\add*, \w burned|strong="H8313"\w* he with \w fire|strong="H0784"\w*:

And all the \w army|strong="H2428"\w* of the \w Chaldeans|strong="H3778"\w*, that \add were\add* with the \w captain|strong="H7227"\w* of the \w guard|strong="H2876"\w*, brake \w down|strong="H5422"\w* all the \w walls|strong="H2346"\w* of \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w* round \w about|strong="H5439"\w*.

Then \w Nebuzar-adan|strong="H5018"\w* the \w captain|strong="H7227"\w* of the \w guard|strong="H2876"\w* carried away \w captive|strong="H1540"\w* \add certain\add* of the \w poor|strong="H1803"\w* of the \w people|strong="H5971"\w*, and the \w residue|strong="H3499"\w* of the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* that \w remained|strong="H7604"\w* in the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*, and those that fell \w away|strong="H5307"\w*, that \w fell|strong="H5307"\w* to the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w*, and the \w rest|strong="H3499"\w* of the \w multitude|strong="H0527"\w*.

But \w Nebuzar-adan|strong="H5018"\w* the \w captain|strong="H7227"\w* of the \w guard|strong="H2876"\w* \w left|strong="H7604"\w* \add certain\add* of the \w poor|strong="H1803"\w* of the \w land|strong="H0776"\w* for \w vinedressers|strong="H3755"\w* and for \w husbandmen|strong="H3009"\w*.

Also the \w pillars|strong="H5982"\w* of \w brass|strong="H5178"\w* that \add were\add* in the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and the \w bases|strong="H4350"\w*, and the \w brasen|strong="H5178"\w* \w sea|strong="H3220"\w* that \add was\add* in the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, the \w Chaldeans|strong="H3778"\w* \w brake|strong="H7665"\w*, and \w carried|strong="H5375"\w* all the \w brass|strong="H5178"\w* of them to \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w*.

The \w caldrons|strong="H5518"\w* also, and the \w shovels|strong="H3257"\w*, and the \w snuffers|strong="H4212"\w*, and the \w bowls|strong="H4219"\w*, and the \w spoons|strong="H3709"\w*, and all the \w vessels|strong="H3627"\w* of \w brass|strong="H5178"\w* wherewith they \w ministered|strong="H8334"\w*, took they \w away|strong="H3947"\w*.\f + \fr 52.18 \ft shovels: or, instruments to remove the ashes\f*\f + \fr 52.18 \ft bowls: or, basons\f*

And the \w basons|strong="H5592"\w*, and the \w firepans|strong="H4289"\w*, and the \w bowls|strong="H4219"\w*, and the \w caldrons|strong="H5518"\w*, and the \w candlesticks|strong="H4501"\w*, and the \w spoons|strong="H3709"\w*, and the \w cups|strong="H4518"\w*; \add that\add* which \add was\add* of \w gold|strong="H2091"\w* \add in\add* \w gold|strong="H2091"\w*, and \add that\add* which \add was\add* of \w silver|strong="H3701"\w* \add in\add* \w silver|strong="H3701"\w*, \w took|strong="H3947"\w* the \w captain|strong="H7227"\w* of the \w guard|strong="H2876"\w* \w away|strong="H3947"\w*.\f + \fr 52.19 \ft firepans: or, censers\f*

The \w two|strong="H8147"\w* \w pillars|strong="H5982"\w*, \w one|strong="H0259"\w* \w sea|strong="H3220"\w*, and \w twelve|strong="H8147"\w* \w brasen|strong="H5178"\w* \w bulls|strong="H1241"\w* that \add were\add* under the \w bases|strong="H4350"\w*, which \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w Solomon|strong="H8010"\w* had \w made|strong="H6213"\w* in the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: the \w brass|strong="H5178"\w* of all these \w vessels|strong="H3627"\w* was without \w weight|strong="H4948"\w*.\f + \fr 52.20 \ft the brass: Heb. their brass\f*

And \add concerning\add* the \w pillars|strong="H5982"\w*, the \w height|strong="H6967"\w* of \w one|strong="H0259"\w* \w pillar|strong="H5982"\w* \add was\add* \w eighteen|strong="H8083"\w* \w cubits|strong="H0520"\w*; and a \w fillet|strong="H2339"\w* of \w twelve|strong="H8147"\w* \w cubits|strong="H0520"\w* did \w compass|strong="H5437"\w* it; and the \w thickness|strong="H5672"\w* thereof \add was\add* \w four|strong="H0702"\w* \w fingers|strong="H0676"\w*: \add it was\add* \w hollow|strong="H5014"\w*.\f + \fr 52.21 \ft fillet: Heb. thread\f*

And a \w chapiter|strong="H3805"\w* of \w brass|strong="H5178"\w* \add was\add* upon it; and the \w height|strong="H6967"\w* of \w one|strong="H0259"\w* \w chapiter|strong="H3805"\w* \add was\add* \w five|strong="H2568"\w* \w cubits|strong="H0520"\w*, with \w network|strong="H7639"\w* and \w pomegranates|strong="H7416"\w* upon the \w chapiters|strong="H3805"\w* round \w about|strong="H5439"\w*, all \add of\add* \w brass|strong="H5178"\w*. The \w second|strong="H8145"\w* \w pillar|strong="H5982"\w* also and the \w pomegranates|strong="H7416"\w* \add were\add* like unto these.

And there were \w ninety|strong="H8673"\w* and \w six|strong="H8337"\w* \w pomegranates|strong="H7416"\w* on a \w side|strong="H7307"\w*; \add and\add* all the \w pomegranates|strong="H7416"\w* upon the \w network|strong="H7639"\w* \add were\add* an \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* round \w about|strong="H5439"\w*.

¶ And the \w captain|strong="H7227"\w* of the \w guard|strong="H2876"\w* \w took|strong="H3947"\w* \w Seraiah|strong="H8304"\w* the \w chief|strong="H7218"\w* \w priest|strong="H3548"\w*, and \w Zephaniah|strong="H6846"\w* the \w second|strong="H4932"\w* \w priest|strong="H3548"\w*, and the \w three|strong="H7969"\w* \w keepers|strong="H8104"\w* of the \w door|strong="H5592"\w*:\f + \fr 52.24 \ft door: Heb. threshold\f*

He \w took|strong="H3947"\w* also out of the \w city|strong="H5892"\w* \w an|strong="H0259"\w* \w eunuch|strong="H5631"\w*, which had the \w charge|strong="H6496"\w* of the \w men|strong="H0582"\w* of \w war|strong="H4421"\w*; and \w seven|strong="H7651"\w* \w men|strong="H0582"\w* of them that were \w near|strong="H7200"\w* the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w person|strong="H6440"\w*, which were \w found|strong="H4672"\w* in the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*; and the \w principal|strong="H8269"\w* \w scribe|strong="H5608"\w* of the \w host|strong="H6635"\w*, who \w mustered|strong="H6633"\w* the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* of the \w land|strong="H0776"\w*; and \w threescore|strong="H8346"\w* \w men|strong="H0376"\w* of the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* of the \w land|strong="H0776"\w*, that were \w found|strong="H4672"\w* in the \w midst|strong="H8432"\w* of the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*.\f + \fr 52.25 \ft were near…: Heb. saw the face of the king\f*\f + \fr 52.25 \ft principal…: or, scribe of the captain of the host\f*

So \w Nebuzar-adan|strong="H5018"\w* the \w captain|strong="H7227"\w* of the \w guard|strong="H2876"\w* \w took|strong="H3947"\w* them, and \w brought|strong="H3212"\w* them to the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w* to \w Riblah|strong="H7247"\w*.

And the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w* \w smote|strong="H5221"\w* them, and put them to \w death|strong="H4191"\w* in \w Riblah|strong="H7247"\w* in the \w land|strong="H0127"\w* of \w Hamath|strong="H2574"\w*. Thus \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w* was carried away \w captive|strong="H1540"\w* out of his own \w land|strong="H0776"\w*.

This \add is\add* the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* whom \w Nebuchadrezzar|strong="H5019"\w* carried away \w captive|strong="H1540"\w*: in the \w seventh|strong="H7651"\w* \w year|strong="H8141"\w* \w three|strong="H7969"\w* \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w* \w Jews|strong="H3064"\w* and \w three|strong="H7969"\w* and \w twenty|strong="H6242"\w*:

In the \w eighteenth|strong="H8083"\w* \w year|strong="H8141"\w* of \w Nebuchadrezzar|strong="H5019"\w* he carried away \w captive|strong="H1540"\w* from \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w* \w eight|strong="H8083"\w* \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w thirty|strong="H7970"\w* and \w two|strong="H8147"\w* \w persons|strong="H5315"\w*:\f + \fr 52.29 \ft persons: Heb. souls\f*

In the \w three|strong="H7969"\w* and \w twentieth|strong="H6242"\w* \w year|strong="H8141"\w* of \w Nebuchadrezzar|strong="H5019"\w* \w Nebuzar-adan|strong="H5018"\w* the \w captain|strong="H7227"\w* of the \w guard|strong="H2876"\w* carried away \w captive|strong="H1540"\w* of the \w Jews|strong="H3064"\w* \w seven|strong="H7651"\w* \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w forty|strong="H0705"\w* and \w five|strong="H2568"\w* \w persons|strong="H5315"\w*: all the \w persons|strong="H5315"\w* \add were\add* \w four|strong="H0702"\w* \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w* and \w six|strong="H8337"\w* \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w*.

¶ And it came to pass in the \w seven|strong="H7651"\w* and \w thirtieth|strong="H7970"\w* \w year|strong="H8141"\w* of the \w captivity|strong="H1546"\w* of \w Jehoiachin|strong="H3078"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w*, in the \w twelfth|strong="H8147"\w* \w month|strong="H2320"\w*, in the \w five|strong="H2568"\w* and \w twentieth|strong="H6242"\w* \add day\add* of the \w month|strong="H2320"\w*, \add that\add* \w Evil-merodach|strong="H0192"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w* in the \add first\add* \w year|strong="H8141"\w* of his \w reign|strong="H4438"\w* lifted \w up|strong="H5375"\w* the \w head|strong="H7218"\w* of \w Jehoiachin|strong="H3078"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w*, and brought him \w forth|strong="H3318"\w* out of \w prison|strong="H1004"\w*,

And \w spake|strong="H1696"\w* \w kindly|strong="H2896"\w* unto him, and \w set|strong="H5414"\w* his \w throne|strong="H3678"\w* \w above|strong="H4605"\w* the \w throne|strong="H3678"\w* of the \w kings|strong="H4428"\w* that \add were\add* with him in \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w*,\f + \fr 52.32 \ft kindly…: Heb. good things with him\f*

And \w changed|strong="H8138"\w* his \w prison|strong="H3608"\w* \w garments|strong="H0899"\w*: and he did \w continually|strong="H8548"\w* \w eat|strong="H0398"\w* \w bread|strong="H3899"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* him all the \w days|strong="H3117"\w* of his \w life|strong="H2416"\w*.

And \add for\add* his \w diet|strong="H0737"\w*, there was a \w continual|strong="H8548"\w* \w diet|strong="H0737"\w* \w given|strong="H5414"\w* him of the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w*, \w every|strong="H3117"\w* \w day|strong="H3117"\w* a \w portion|strong="H1697"\w* until the \w day|strong="H3117"\w* of his \w death|strong="H4194"\w*, all the \w days|strong="H3117"\w* of his \w life|strong="H2416"\w*.\f + \fr 52.34 \ft every…: Heb. the matter of the day in his day\f*
